actions.action: Write a tutorial that shows how to test EJBs.
Add a sample that shows how to test EJBs.
Add support for testing custom JSP Taglibs (suggested by Sohail Aslam) + tutorial + sample
Add support for testing Servlet API 2.3 Filters.
Provide a mechanism for easier testing of EJBs. The mechanism is to be defined (requested by notyy).
Make the methods setUp() and tearDown() protected on the server side so that it is consistent with JUnit (for the moment they need to be public to work).
Manage multivalued HTTP headers in ServletTestRequest.
Write a Cactus integration tutorial for JBuilder 4.
Write a Cactus integration tutorial for VAJava 3.5.
Add Ant scripts to support WebLogic 6.0.
Handle getRealPath(), getPathTranslated() in the ServletRedirectorRequest class.
On the Cactus news web page, provide a list of pages that have been recently modified so that end users can see at a glance what has changed recently on the web site.
Generate changelog file from CVS change log information and put in the documentation of each release.
Add a license section to the Cactus web site that explains that Cactus is under the APL license and shows the license statement.
Add a contributing section to the Cactus web site (see the contributing section of Cocoon as a sample).

On the documentation web pages (i.e. not the site web pages) add a sub header for each page with a message saying "Click here if you want to see the latest online version of this page". Modify a stylebook stylesheet to do this (combined with an Ant token filter or an Ant replace task).

Add API in ServletTestRequest to send data to the URL connection output stream. This is to easily test code that sends bytes of data as POST data to the servlet (requested by Daniel Cohen and custommonkey).

Automatically add the query string parameters defined when using the ServletTestRequest.setURL() API to the list of parameters passed to the server redirector, so that it won't be necessary to call ServletTestRequest.addParameter() for each of these parameters.
Integration for Netbeans by integration with the Netbeans XTest module.
